page.title: 06Farming An Arable Farm
page.content: Yesterday we went to visit a large arable farm which was about 250 Acres in area. The fields were spread about the countryside and not in a single block. The farmer is both the owner and the manager. Wheat, barley, oats and spring beans are his most important crops. Most of the land is given over to wheat as this is the most profitable crop. The type grown, as we found on most farms in the area, is hard wheat, which is a fodder crop. The farmers most busy time is from July to October when he harvests his crops and prepares the ground for next season's crops. Most farmers sell to merchants who take samples of the crop and who then arrange transport in bulk lorries direct from the farm.
